abstract.p: Herbert Kupferberg letter on Matthew Gurewitsch's July 23 article notes phrase 'the matter of Troy' was first used by Walt Whitman in 1871 poem Song of the Exposition (S)

block.p: In his article ''The Epic That Raised a Thousand Curtains'' [July 23], Matthew Gurewitsch mentions ''what the literati used to call 'the matter of Troy.' '' I don't know which literati he means, but the phrase was first used by Walt Whitman in his 1871 poem ''Song of the Exposition.'' Whitman called upon the poetic Muse to abandon its ancient subjects -- ''That matter of Troy and Achilles' wrath'' -- and take up residence instead in the New World of industry, invention and technology.
